document.heading: PUEBLO DE SAN ILDEFONSO COUNCIL RESOLUTION NO. SI-R20-013
Audit Authorization, Acceptance, and Responsibility Act
document.preamble: At a duly called meeting of the Council of San Ildefonso Pueblo on the 28th day of July, 2020, the following Resolution was adopted:

recital.text: the Governing Agreement requires the Pueblo to conduct and annual financial audit by an independent auditor; and,
the annual audit is an important indicator of the Pueblo's accounting practices and financial health, and is a valuable tool to safeguard the financial assets of the Pueblo; and,

the Governor of the Pueblo oversees and directs the Accounting Department personnel, engages the independent auditor, and is vested with the executive authority and responsibility to ensure that the annual audit is conducted and accepted by the Pueblo and that a plan to address any audit findings is developed and implemented.
that the Council hereby enacts the attached law entitled, "AUDIT AUTHORIZATION, ACCEPTANCE, AND RESPONSIBILITY ACT."

procedural-data.text: The foregoing resolution was duly voted upon by the Council on July 28, 2020, at a meeting with a vote of 10 in favor, 0 opposed, 0 abstaining and 0 absent (Governor presiding and not voting) pursuant to the authority vested in the Council by the Agreement of the Pueblo de San Ildefonso.

attachment.heading: AUDIT AUTHORIZATION, ACCEPTANCE, AND RESPONSIBILITY ACT

section.heading: Short Title
section.text: This enactment shall be known as the "AUDIT AUTHORIZATION, ACCEPTANCE, AND RESPONSIBILITY ACT ("Act")."

section.heading: Purpose
section.text: The purpose of this act is to:

para.text: Authorize and direct the Governor to complete an external financial audit of the Pueblo in accordance with the requirements of the Governing Agreement; and
Authorize the Governor to procure an independent licensed auditor; and

Require the Governor to provide a copy of the annual audit report to the Council and to direct the auditor to make an in-person presentation to the Council, and to assign to the Governor the responsibility to accept or reject the annual audit prepared by the auditors; and
Require the Governor to develop and implement a plan to adequately address all audit findings identified in the annual audit.
the Governing Agreement requires the Pueblo to conduct an annual financial audit by an independent auditor; and
the annual audit is an important indicator of the Pueblo's accounting practices and financial health, and is a valuable tool to safeguard the financial assets of the Pueblo; and

the Governor of the Pueblo oversees and directs the Accounting Department personnel, engages the independent auditor, and is vested with the executive authority and responsibility to ensure that the annual audit is conducted and accepted by the Pueblo and that a plan to address all audit findings is developed and implemented.

The Governor is hereby authorized to negotiate and execute a contract with external and independent qualified auditors to conduct and complete an annual financial audit for the Pueblo in accordance with the requirements of the Governing Agreement.

The Governor shall provide a copy of the annual audit report to the Council prior to Governor's acceptance, and shall direct the auditor to make an in-person presentation to the Council regarding the annual audit.
